app_subtitle: A web UI based on udp2raw
safety_faketcp: FakeTCP mode REQUIRES iptables rules to block kernel TCP RST packets.
safety_openwrt: On OpenWrt, iptables rules may be cleared when network settings change.
safety_recommend: The "Keep Iptables Rules" option is STRONGLY recommended for OpenWrt.
safety_server: Server Mode: You MUST specify "Forward To" address (usually 127.0.0.1).
enable_service_hint: ⓘ Master switch. If disabled, no tunnels will run.
keep_iptables_hint: ✓ Auto-restore iptables rules if cleared by system. Recommended.
wait_iptables_hint: ⓘ Wait for xtables lock while invoking iptables. Prevents failures during boot.
retry_on_error_hint: ⓘ Allow starting even if network is not ready. Recommended for auto-start.
server_desc: Server Mode: OpenWrt listens for connections from remote clients.
server_traffic_flow: Traffic Flow: Internet → WAN Port → [Decrypted] → Forward To IP:Port.
client_desc: Client Mode: OpenWrt connects to remote udp2raw server (VPS).
client_traffic_flow: Traffic Flow: App → Local Port → [Encrypted] → Forward To VPS IP:Port.
name: Name
password_hint: ⓘ Encryption password. Must match client configuration exactly.
wan_listen_address_hint: ⓘ Address to listen on. Use 0.0.0.0 for all interfaces.
local_listen_address_hint: ⓘ Local address to listen on. Usually 127.0.0.1.
raw_mode_hint: ⓘ Transport protocol. FakeTCP is recommended for bypassing firewalls.
cipher_mode_hint: ⓘ Encryption method. XOR is fast and usually sufficient.
auth_mode_hint: ⓘ Authentication method. Simple is basic protection.
source_ip_hint: ⓘ Client only. Force source-ip for raw socket.
source_port_hint: ⓘ Client only. Disables port changing while re-connecting.
seq_mode_hint: ⓘ FakeTCP behavior simulation. Mode 3 is recommended.
auto_iptables_hint: ⓘ Required for FakeTCP mode. Auto-adds iptables rules.
confirm_delete: Are you sure you want to delete this instance?

login_footer: Set password via WEB_PASSWORD environment variable
